title: Connection not encrypted
content:
Somewhere around September 6 something changed in Firefox which prevents me from accessing my control area for a website I own. The error says: " your connection to this site is not private. Information ...". I am the only person with access to this site and my password to the site is 20 characters long with special character and randomly generate. Everything worked well and doesn't work on any computer in my house. This change in your software is costing me money as I can't work on my website. I am not a happy camper. Please tell me how to resolve this problem. Telling me to ask the hosting company to make changes is not a valid response.

Shannon
creator: TigerLilly56

title: How do I get search results FROM the new tab page to OPEN in a new tab
content:
By default, search results from the "new tab" page don't open a new tab, because that page is meant to be opened prior to initiating a search. However, I prefer to have the new tab page pinned so that non pinned tabs can all be closed and have something to fall back to other than my pinned tabs.

Therefor, it would be nice to disable search results opening a new tab from this "new tab" page due to how I use it (which is a preference that is required for having pinned tabs since the home page does not open unless all tabs are closed).

title: Opening Firefox cause shutdown the PC
content:

And also I use several addons in my firefox but only 3 (ABP, YoutubeAdBlock & Kaspersky Web Safer) is active. I'm using firefox since 2005 until now. IDK what the problem with my firefox, I never found bad issues like this before. When I try to start firefox suddenly my laptop is turnoff automatically & I try to start again but now I saw on task bar manager firefox make a 100% CPU usage and once again it shut it down the Laptop. This happens often, I wish I know what the heck is going on! But now I got another issue when starting firefox, that say "Error: Platform version '104.0.2' is not compatible with...", I'd love to share the SS if you don't mind.

Thanks & Regards, Punk06
creator: ass_punk06

title: "Wordstringtext" New incompatibility emerged with certain websites and OpenWeb comment service
content:
"Wordstringtext", New incompatibility emerged with certain websites and OpenWeb comment service. I have contacted both but have not received the courtesy of a reply. [yet]

First week of September 2022, suddenly a new problem emerged. First discovered at the Fox News website, when entering a comment (OpenWeb). The space between the last letter of the word before the first letter of the next word gets immediately deleted up on typing the next word. The end result is a text "band-worm" with no spaces. Another issue is that there is now suddenly a lengthy blank space (several scrolls) between the article and at the comment section.

Example of entering text: e.g. "this text entered here to make a comment appears as "thistextenteredheretomakeacomment".

Also unlike before, when pressing <space-bar> it limits to 1 space and you cannot add another i.e. double or more spaces. Once you begin typing upon entering the first letter of a word following the space, the cursor skips one character back eliminating the space. Laptop which OS and Firefox and noticed the same problem. Office computer the same problem. The issue apparently does not appear in chrome and/or edge. I can confirm that the problem can be reproduced with FF version 88 throughout to 10X & WaterFox all up to G4.1.5.

I suspect that "OpenWeb" saw the need to "update" something again. However, hoping to get a reply from their virtually non-existing support is like bringing a dead dog back to life by beating it. A futile attempt at best.

PS in the week with this problem suddenly appeared no "updates" of any kind where [willingly & knowingly] done on any system.

PPS Please no replies suggesting I try upgrade Firefox to whatever latest current. I tested all. I need a stable and reliable solution and not constantly a "Shove-it-down-your-throat-whether-you-want-or-like-it" new introduction of incompatibilities et al wasting my time and crippling my work flow.. It is this narco style "update mania" that creates all these totally unnecessary problems.

Constant "Upgrades" --the "Fentanyl" or food with sugar lacing of everything.
creator: dorcom

title: [Dúvida] Controlar volume do som por aba individual
content:
Gostaria de saber alguma forma de conseguir controlar o volume de som de duas abas de forma individual. Exemplo: estou utilizando um site gerador de sons (mynoise.net) para bloquear os sons externos, e estudando por outro site (em outra aba). Se eu diminuir o volume do Firefox os dois sites diminuem o volume juntos, e eu queria deixar o som do mynoise na frequência correta porém com volume menor, e aumentar do site onde estou estudando (para conseguir ouvir a voz do professor), porém ele já está no máximo dentro da plataforma.

Já tentei abrir em outra janela em vez de guia, mas ainda aparece no mixer de som do windows como apenas firefox, e não cada janela de forma individual.

O que me indicam? Obrigada!
creator: skhard

title: firefox mouse hover effects delayed
content:
Hello,

After installing Firefox (103.0.2) on a clean install of Manjaro (21.3.7) Gnome (42.4), I started noticing that mouse hover effects such as highlighted tabs, UI of a video-player appearing etc. are delayed after my PC exits hibernation (I am not sure if that is the only cause and if that really IS the cause). Weirdly enough the select menu I used to answer the "Which topic best describes your question?" question to create this post experiences no delay in highlighting the hovered element. Relaunching Firefox fixes this issue temporarily.

To be clear this is no performance issue since everything except mouse hover related interactions are fluid.

Thanks for helping out
creator: Nydragon

So please don't tell me there could be another reason for this problem about the Space bar button. The Space bar functions perfectly on Windows 10 Edge as well. Even tried it temporarily on Vivaldi. Until Firefox fixes that problem, I have no need to use the Firefox Browser with it's constant annoying updates.

title: command + F not working
content:
Command + F has suddenly stopped working. Other command functions (e.g., command + L) continue to work as expected, including cut/copy/paste. But command + F simply does not work (going to the menu and selecting the manually selecting the magnifying glass also still works, so it’s not something systemic with the search window, i wouldn’t think).

I posted a message on the App Store indicating the situation, and received a reply from the dev asking me to post my “report” here - not sure if this qualifies, though.

title: Unable to connect
content:
Using a MacBook Pro 2018 with macOS 12.6.1 and Firefox 104.0.2.

Lately, while going to various site, one such s Amazon and many others, I receive the following message:

Unable to connect

An error occurred during a connection to www.amazon.com. 

   The site could be temporarily unavailable or too busy. Try again in a few moments.    If you are unable to load any pages, check your computer’s network connection.    If your computer or network is protected by a firewall or proxy, make sure that Firefox is permitted to access the Web.

All three of these suggestions DO NOT WORK! I can go to many other sites without any problems. These “Unable to connect” site do connect using Safari and Google WHY not Firefox? I’ve dropped these other browsers years ago but it’s beginning to look like I’ll have to drop Firefox. Also, just to go to Firefox “Submit Feedback” or Firefox “Help”, the same thing happened, see above!

I need help and/or BETTER suggestions!

title: closing Firefox on linux from the terminal and avoiding "restore session" warnings
content:
I'm trying to just close and restart firefox from some bash scripts on Linux so that I can manage a few items from various hotkeys.

I'm trying to close an existing Firefox process "cleanly", and am running into issues with how to kill the Firefox process and have it restart without showing the "restore session" page. If I update about:config and override "browser.sessionstore.resume_from_crash" to false, then I get the behavior I'm looking for, but I'd rather not have to override this.

I've tried multiple kill signals from the `kill` command, including HUP, STOP, QUIT, TERM, INT, however all of them seem to trigger the same behavior.

So is there a way to cleanly close (or restart) Firefox from the terminal?
creator: erickj

title: Firefox changed my password, but didn't save it!
content:
Hey Firefox Team,

Earlier this evening, I was doing a little security update and changing the password to my Twitter and email addresses. Standard stuff. Firefox suggested a secure password and I agreed; Firefox came up with a good one. The key icon in the URL bar showed a little message that said it had saved the passwords. Hooray.

It turns out, it didn't update my passwords at all and now I am locked out of my accounts. Firefox hasn't saved these new passwords it came up with and I'm stuck with my old ones which, obviously, don't work.

What can I do?
creator: JTDJTD
